## Converters.ObjectConverter class

A [Converter](./ts-utils.converter.md) which converts an object of type `<T>` without changing shape, given a [FieldConverters&lt;T&gt;](./ts-utils.converters.fieldconverters.md) for the fields in the object.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class ObjectConverter<T, TC = unknown> extends BaseConverter<T, TC> 
```
**Extends:** [BaseConverter](./ts-utils.baseconverter.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, TC&gt;

## Remarks

By default, if all of the required fields exist and can be converted, returns a new object with the converted values under the original key names. If any required fields do not exist or cannot be converted, the entire conversion fails. See [ObjectConverterOptions](./ts-utils.converters.objectconverteroptions.md) for other conversion options.

|  [(constructor)(fields, optional)](./ts-utils.converters.objectconverter._constructor__1.md) |  | Constructs a new [ObjectConverter&lt;T&gt;](./ts-utils.converters.objectconverter.md) with optional properties specified as an array of <code>keyof T</code>. |
